basics.name: Krystin Villeneuve
basics.label: Full Stack Software Developer
basics.summary: Motivated software developer with over two years of enterprise experience seeking a great team. Dedicated consulatant with demonstrable strength building solid relationships with business partners. Team player with strong collaboration skills. Tenacious problem solver with an eclectic technical skillset and polyglot tendencies.

work.summary: Mentoring new developer apprentices while delivering client solutions
highlights: Integrated myWorld API (GIS library) with Salesforce to deliver a proof of concept that resulted in a year long contract with an international infrastructure services company. During that time, several different record-specific customized map concepts were delivered using JavaScript, Apex, and Salesforce Lightning Components
Created a command line tool with python and xcel wings to automate transformation and loading of 110GB data set from various Excel formats into a cohesive SQLite database
Built a lightweight prototype in Electron to demonstrate cloud based storage interface potential
Implemented new features and UI changes in meteorological data application used to model potential disaster recommendation using Knockoutjs, Python, SQLAlchemy for ORM, and Express
Contributed to company wide effort at Techtonic to relaunch company website with React, GraphQL, and Contentful

work.summary: University of Denver bootcamp (part time, remote)
highlights: Provide in class hands on assistance covering a broad range of web development topics and assisting with classroom management
Tutor new developers learning HTML/CSS, Bootstrap, Javascript, Express, React, Node, MongoDB, GitHub, Git

work.summary: Partnered with local outreach organizations to provide access to modern communications to families in need
highlights: Led a team of over 15 independent distributors in the state of Colorado, increasing target distribution by 4000 units per month
Formed partnerships with local organizations, such as food banks, to maximize community outreach
Assisted private business owners in recruiting and training field representatives in California
Identified successful target areas in Colorado and California, increasing distribution for franchisees by 10-40%

work.summary: Combat veteran (avionics repairer, US Army), defense contractor, student

education.area: Over 200 hours of study in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, MVC, Ajax, jQuery followed by 1000 hours of paid apprenticeship
Over 125 hours including HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, jQuery, and 50 hours of algorithms training problems

education.institution: Turing School of Software and Design
education.area: Over 500 hours of including HTML5, HTML5 Canvas, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, React, Git, GitHub, pair programming, and TDD (Jasmine and Selenium webdriver)
